benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/paymentMethods/{paymentMethodId}/setDefault - Set the default payment method

covered: PUT - Valid Request: Happy paths covered (204) with required header only, with payAllUnpaidInvoices=true, with pluginProperty, and with optional headers; verifies default flag set and audit log entries.
PUT - Non-Existing Resource: 404s for non-existent account/payment method and when payment method does not belong to the account; account with no payment methods.
PUT - Concurrency: Concurrent requests result in a single default method; consistency asserted.
Input validation: UUID format errors return 400 (invalid/partial UUIDs), boundary UUIDs exercised; missing required header returns 400; unexpected extra query param tolerated.
Behavioral side effects: payAllUnpaidInvoices=true triggers attempts to pay unpaid invoices; scenario for no unpaid invoices ensures no attempts.
Resilience/availability: 503 for service down; 503/504 for slow downstream dependency.
Security: Injection attempt in X-Killbill-CreatedBy is rejected; no execution.
Regression/data integrity: New default clears old default.
gaps: Idempotency: No explicit test that repeating the same PUT (when the payment method is already default) remains idempotent (still 204, no duplicate side effects).

payAllUnpaidInvoices validation: No test for invalid/non-boolean values (e.g., payAllUnpaidInvoices=abc) returning 400; no explicit test for payAllUnpaidInvoices=false ensuring no attempts occur even with unpaid invoices.
Error mapping for server failures: No scenario for generic 500 (e.g., DB failure) to confirm correct error code and body.
Optional headers validation: No boundary/validation tests for X-Killbill-Reason/Comment (e.g., very long values, special characters, injection) and how they are stored/truncated in audit.
Response semantics: For 204, no assertion that the response body is empty and headers are appropriate (e.g., Content-Type absent or consistent with spec that claims produces application/json).
Request payload/content-type: No test for handling an unexpected JSON request body or wrong Content-Type (e.g., 415 or ignore body).
Plugin properties robustness: No tests for extreme pluginProperty values (length, special characters), duplicate keys behavior, or invalid encoding.
Authorization depth: No 403 Forbidden scenario for authenticated but unauthorized user/role.
Post-condition observability: No follow-up verification that future payments (e.g., next invoice auto-payment) actually use the new default method.
recommendations: Add an idempotency scenario: call the endpoint twice with the same already-default payment method; expect 204 both times, no extra payment attempts, and unchanged state.
Extend payAllUnpaidInvoices coverage: include payAllUnpaidInvoices=false and invalid values (abc/1/yes) leading to 400; verify false causes no payment attempts even with unpaid invoices.
Introduce a 500 Internal Server Error simulation (e.g., DB outage) and validate error contract (status, errorCode, message).
Validate optional headers: test oversized Reason/Comment, special characters, and injection; assert safe storage/truncation and proper audit log rendering.
Assert response semantics for 204: verify empty body and headers (especially Content-Type) comply with the API spec that lists produces application/json.
Negative payload test: send a JSON body with Content-Type: application/json to confirm it is rejected or ignored per spec (define expected behavior).
Strengthen pluginProperty tests: very long values, URL-encoded/special characters, duplicates, and maximum length enforcement with clear outcomes.
Add a 403 Forbidden scenario for authenticated users lacking required permissions to set default payment methods.
Add an end-to-end post-condition: after setting the default, create/trigger a payment and assert the new default method is used.
